Run UMAP dimensionality reduction

Source: R/dimensionality_reduction.R
run_umap.Rd

Performs Uniform Manifold Approximation and Projection (UMAP) on a Seurat object using PCA results as input. UMAP is a dimensionality reduction technique that preserves both local and global structure of the data.

Usage

run_umap(
  seurat_obj,
  n_neighbors = 30,
  min_dist = 0.3,
  n_components = 2,
  verbose = TRUE
)

Arguments

seurat_obj

Seurat object. The Seurat object to run UMAP on.

n_neighbors

Integer. Number of neighbors for UMAP (default: 30). This parameter controls how UMAP balances local versus global structure. Lower values preserve more local structure, while higher values preserve more global structure.

min_dist

Numeric. Minimum distance for UMAP (default: 0.3). This parameter controls how tightly UMAP is allowed to pack points together. Lower values allow points to be closer together, while higher values force points to be more spread out.

n_components

Integer. Number of UMAP components to compute (default: 2). This determines the dimensionality of the output embedding.

verbose

Logical. Whether to print progress messages (default: TRUE).

Value

A Seurat object with UMAP coordinates added to the reductions slot. The UMAP coordinates can be accessed using:

  • seurat_obj@reductions$umap - The UMAP reduction object

  • seurat_obj@reductions$umap@cell.embeddings - The UMAP coordinates

Details

The function performs the following steps:

  1. Checks if PCA has been run, runs it if necessary

  2. Performs UMAP using the first 30 principal components

  3. Stores the results in the Seurat object

The UMAP algorithm:

  • Constructs a high dimensional graph on the data

  • Optimizes a low dimensional layout to preserve the graph structure

  • Can capture both local and global structure in the data

See also

perform_pca for PCA analysis perform_tsne for t-SNE analysis

Examples

# \donttest{
# Basic usage
seurat_obj <- run_umap(
  seurat_obj = seurat_obj
)
#> Error: object 'seurat_obj' not found

# Custom number of neighbors
seurat_obj <- run_umap(
  seurat_obj = seurat_obj,
  n_neighbors = 15
)
#> Error: object 'seurat_obj' not found

# Custom minimum distance
seurat_obj <- run_umap(
  seurat_obj = seurat_obj,
  min_dist = 0.1
)
#> Error: object 'seurat_obj' not found

# 3D UMAP
seurat_obj <- run_umap(
  seurat_obj = seurat_obj,
  n_components = 3
)
#> Error: object 'seurat_obj' not found
# }
